name: Ravager Spawn (Flier Form)
senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 24
damageResistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abilities.name: Charge.
abilities.fullText:
Charge. If the Ravager moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature
and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed
on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is
prone, the Ravager can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

abilities.name: Flyby.
abilities.fullText:
Flyby. The Ravager doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies
out of an enemy’s reach.

abilities.name: Form-Shifting.
abilities.fullText:
Form-Shifting. The Ravager can physically alter its physiology to
take on one of the three listed forms: the crawler, the brawler, or the flier.
Doing so takes one minute, and during this period it cannot take any other
actions, though it is not considered incapacitated.

abilities.name: Improved Critical.
abilities.fullText:
Improved Critical. The Ravager’s bite and claws score a critical hit on
a roll of 19 or 20.

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If the Ravager fails a saving throw, it
can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Disruption.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Disruption. Every time the Ravager comes into contact with
magical effects, there is a chance that it disrupts it. This effect functions as
per the dispel magic spell cast using a 5th level spell slot with a +5 spell
casting ability modifier.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. The Ravager’s melee attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Rampage.
abilities.fullText:
Rampage. When the Ravager reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a
melee attack on its turn, the Ravager can take a bonus action to move up
to half its speed and make a bite attack.

abilities.name: Regeneration.
abilities.fullText:
Regeneration. The Ravager regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn.
If the Ravager takes damage from an artifact or from a legendary action,
this trait doesn’t function at the start of the Ravager’s next turn. The
Ravager only dies if it starts its turn at 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

abilities.name: Vampiric Healing.
abilities.fullText:
Vampiric Healing. Whenever the Ravager hits with a melee attack, it
regains hit points equal to half the damage it inflicts on its opponent, up to
its hit point maximum.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. The Ravager makes one bite and four claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite.

Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 29
(6d6 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.

Claws. Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit:
36 (8d6 + 8) slashing damage.

abilities.fullText:
Special Equipment. The Horned Lord wears a cloak of protection,
ring of spell turning, and a black robe of the archmagi. He has +1 to
all saving throws while wearing the cloak. He also wields the infamous
Harrowblade (see sidebar for more details).

abilities.name: Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Spellcasting. The Horned Lord is an 18th level spellcaster. Its
spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 22, +14 to hit with spell
attacks). The Horned Lord has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): acid splash, chill touch, ray of frost, 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, 2nd level (3 slots): acid arrow, blur, detect thoughts, levitate, 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic, fireball, lightning bolt, 4th level (3 slots): confusion, ice storm, 5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying, 6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, wall of ice, 7th level (1 slot): finger of death, teleport, 8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun, 9th level (1 slot): power word kill

abilities.name: Turn Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Turn Resistance. The Horned Lord has advantage on saving throws
against any effect that turns undead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. The Horned Lord has advantage on saving throws
against spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Regeneration.
abilities.fullText:
Regeneration. The Horned Lord regains 1d6 hit points at the beginning
of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. The Horned Lord makes three attacks with Harrowblade.

actions.name: Harrowblade.
actions.fullText:
Harrowblade. Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
Hit: 12 (2d6+5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage. On a natural
19 or 20 attack roll, living creatures must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving
throw, taking 14 (4d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much
damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Dominate (Recharge 5–6).
actions.fullText:
Dominate (Recharge 5–6). The Horned Lord speaks in a commanding
voice, calling on all to bow down to him. Each creature within 60 feet
of the Horned Lord must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or
be incapacitated for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at
the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature’s
saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune
to the Horned Lord’s Dominate for the next 24 hours.

name: Ravager Spawn (Brawler Form)
senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 24
damageResistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abilities.name: Charge.
abilities.fullText:
Charge. If the Ravager moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature
and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed
on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is
prone, the Ravager can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

abilities.name: Form-Shifting.
abilities.fullText:
Form-Shifting. The Ravager can physically alter its physiology to
take on one of the three listed forms: the crawler, the brawler, or the flier.
Doing so takes one minute, and during this period it cannot take any other
actions, though it is not considered incapacitated.

abilities.name: Improved Critical.
abilities.fullText:
Improved Critical. The Ravager’s bite and claws score a critical hit on
a roll of 19 or 20.

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If the Ravager fails a saving throw, it
can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Disruption.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Disruption. Every time the Ravager comes into contact with
magical effects, there is a chance that it disrupts it. This effect functions as
per the dispel magic spell cast using a 5th level spell slot with a +5 spell
casting ability modifier.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. The Ravager’s melee attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Rampage.
abilities.fullText:
Rampage. When the Ravager reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a
melee attack on its turn, the Ravager can take a bonus action to move up
to half its speed and make a bite attack.

abilities.name: Regeneration.
abilities.fullText:
Regeneration. The Ravager regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn.
If the Ravager takes damage from an artifact or from a legendary action,
this trait doesn’t function at the start of the Ravager’s next turn. The
Ravager only dies if it starts its turn at 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

abilities.name: Vampiric Healing.
abilities.fullText:
Vampiric Healing. Whenever the Ravager hits with a melee attack, it
regains hit points equal to half the damage it inflicts on its opponent, up to
its hit point maximum.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText:
Multiattack. The Ravager makes one bite and four claw attacks. It can
also make a smash attack if it is grappling a creature.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 31
(6d6 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.fullText:
Claws. Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit:
38 (8d6 + 10) slashing damage and the target is grappled (Escape DC 21).

actions.name: Smash.
actions.fullText:
Smash. If a target is grappled at the beginning of its turn, the Ravager
may smash it into the ground, doing 31 (6d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

name: Ravager Spawn (Crawler Form)
senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 24
damageResistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abilities.name: Tunneler.
abilities.fullText:
Tunneler. The Ravager can burrow through solid rock at half of its
burrowing speed, leaving a 10 foot-wide, 16-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

abilities.name: Vampiric Healing.
abilities.fullText:
Vampiric Healing. Whenever the Ravager hits with a melee attack, it
regains hit points equal to half the damage it inflicts on its opponent, up to
its hit point maximum.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. The Ravager makes one bite and four claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 29
(6d6 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.fullText:
Claws. Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit:
36 (8d6 + 8) slashing damage.

name: Advanced Demilich
damageImmunities: necrotic, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
damageResistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from magical weapons
conditionImmunities: charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

abilities.name: Annulment.
abilities.fullText:
Annulment. If the demi-lich is subjected to an effect that allows it to
make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage
if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If the demi-lich fails a saving throw, it
can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Spellcasting. The demi-lich is an 18th level spellcaster. Its
spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 21, +13
to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells
prepared:

Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, 2nd level (3 slots): acid arrow, detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror
image, 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball, 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door, 5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying, 6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability, 7th level (1 slot): finger of death, plane shift, 8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun, 9th level (1 slot): power word kill

abilities.name: Turn Immunity.
abilities.fullText: Turn Immunity. The demi-lich is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Drain Life.
actions.fullText:
Drain Life. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the demi-lich
must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking
21 (6d6) necrotic damage, and the demi-lich regains hit points equal to the
total dealt to all targets.

actions.name: Soul Shatter (Recharge 6).
actions.fullText:
Soul Shatter (Recharge 6). The demi-lich emits a string of vile words
of power. All creatures within 30 feet of the demi-lich that it can see must
succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points.
On a successful save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is
frightened until the end of its next turn.

name: Cerberus
damageResistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abilities.name: Devil’s Sight.
abilities.fullText: Devil’s Sight. Magical darkness doesn’t impede Cerberus’ darkvision.

abilities.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
abilities.fullText:
Keen Hearing and Smell. Cerberus has advantage on Wisdom
(Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If Cerberus fails a saving throw, it can
choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. Cerberus has advantage on saving throws against
spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Multiple Heads.
abilities.fullText:
Multiple Heads. Cerberus has three heads. While it has more than one
head, Cerberus has advantage on saving throws against being blinded,
charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.
Whenever Cerberus takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its
heads dies. If all its heads die, Cerberus dies.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. Cerberus makes three bite attacks and one claw attack.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23
(3d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.fullText:
Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. Hit: 20
(3d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6).
actions.fullText:
Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6). One of Cerberus’ heads releases a 60-foot
cone of flames. Each creature in the area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving
throw, taking 42 (12d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage
on a successful saving throw. Each head has its own recharge counter.

name: Dagon, Demon Prince of the SeaEmbrace of the Uncaring Sea
languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Giant, Infernal; telepathy 120 ft.
damageImmunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
damageResistances: cold, fire, lightning

abilities.name: Special Equipment.
abilities.fullText:
Special Equipment. Dagon carries Embrace of the Uncaring Sea, a
powerful magic trident.

abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Innate Spellcasting. Dagon’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma
(spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following
spells, requiring no material components. At will: cloudkill (works underwater only), control water, create
and destroy water, darkness, detect evil and good, detect magic, detect
thoughts, magic missile (as the 4th level spell), teleport, telekinesis,
tongues, water breathing, 3/day each: conjure animals (aquatic creatures only), conjure elemental
(water elemental only), dispel magic, dominate beast (aquatic creatures
only), fear, 1/day each: confusion, feeblemind, finger of death, hold person, hold
monster, lightning bolt, stoneskin, time stop, web, wish

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If Dagon fails a saving throw, it can
choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. The demon has advantage on saving throws against
spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. The demon’s weapon attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Unholy Aura.
abilities.fullText:
Unholy Aura. An unholy aura surrounds Dagon out to a radius of 40
feet. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must make a DC
21 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is frightened
for 1 minute. While frightened, they are paralyzed. A frightened target can
repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect
on a success.

abilities.name: Water Mastery.
abilities.fullText:
Water Mastery. Dagon has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks,
and saving throws when even partly immersed in sea water.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. Dagon makes three melee weapon attacks.

actions.name: Embrace of the Uncaring Sea.
actions.fullText:
Embrace of the Uncaring Sea. Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +18
to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10)
piercing damage, or 28 (4d8 + 10) piercing damage if used with two hands
to make a melee attack, plus 17 (5d6) poison damage. If Dagon rolls a
natural 19 or 20, the target must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw
or be afflicted by the crushing pressure of the sea. A creature afflicted by
this cannot breathe, use verbal components, or take actions or reactions.
At the end of each of the target’s turns, it can repeat the saving throw,
ending the effect on a success. Magic such as heal can end this affliction
early.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.fullText:
Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25
(4d8 + 7) slashing damage and target is poisoned until the beginning of
Dagon’s next turn.

actions.name: Command Aquatic Creature (Recharge 5–6).
actions.fullText:
Command Aquatic Creature (Recharge 5–6). One creature with a
swim speed that Dagon can see within 120 feet of it hears the telepathic
commands of Dagon and must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw. On
a failed save, the creature is charmed for 24 hours. While charmed, it
must follow the orders of Dagon to the best of the target’s ability and it is
immune to being charmed or frightened by another effect or spell. A target
can repeat the saving throw when it takes damage, ending the effect on a
success.

name: Maphistal, Second of Orcus
damageResistances: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Innate Spellcasting. Maphistal’s spellcasting ability is Charisma
(spell save DC 22, +14 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells requiring no material components: At will: circle of death, detect evil and good, detect magic, dispel magic, 3/day: animate dead, blight, hallow, suggestion, telekinesis, 1/day: conjure fiend, fire storm, power word stun

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If Maphistal fails a saving throw, he can
choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. Maphistal has advantage on saving throws against
spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Magic Weapon.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapon. Maphistal’s melee attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Rampage.
abilities.fullText:
Rampage. When Maphistal reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a
melee attack on its turn, Maphistal can take a bonus action to move up to
half its speed and make a bite attack.

abilities.name: Unholy Aura.
abilities.fullText:
Unholy Aura. Malevolent shadows swirl around Maphistal and radiate
out from it in a 30-foot radius. Non-evil creatures in this area have
disadvantage on attack rolls against Maphistal and its allies.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText:
Multiattack. Maphistal makes three attacks: one with its bite and two
with its claws.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:
23 (4d6 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must
succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw against disease or
become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that
elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point
maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success.
The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This
reduction to the target’s hit point maximum lasts until the disease is
cured. The disease can be magically cured by a greater restoration
or heal spell.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.fullText:
Claws. Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:
27 (4d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make
a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target’s Dexterity
score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Dexterity to 0.
Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.fullText:
Teleport. Maphistal magically teleports, along with any equipment it
is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Summon (1/day).
actions.fullText:
Summon (1/day). Maphistal summons 1d12 dretches, 1d6 glabrezus,
1d6 hezrous, 1d4 nalfeshnees, 1d3 marilith, or 1 balor. The summoned
demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Maphistal, but
can’t summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or Maphistal
is slain, or until Maphistal takes an action to dismiss it.

name: Pazuzu, Demon Prince of AirCarriontooth
skills: Acrobatics +13, Arcana +12, Athletics +15, Deception +14, Insight +12, Perception +12, Stealth +13, Survival +12
languages: Auran, Aquan, Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Giant, Infernal, Terran; telepathy 120 ft.
damageImmunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
damageResistances: cold, fire, lightning

abilities.name: Special Equipment.
abilities.fullText: Special Equipment. Pazuzu wields the greatsword Carriontooth.

abilities.name: Evasion.
abilities.fullText:
Evasion. If Pazuzu is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a
Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Pazuzu instead takes no
damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

abilities.name: Flyby.
abilities.fullText:
Flyby. Pazuzu doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of
an enemy’s reach.

abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Innate Spellcasting. Pazuzu’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma
(spell save DC 22, +14 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following
spells, requiring no material components. At will: animal messenger, arcane eye, call lightning, detect magic, featherfall, giant insect, gust of wind, insect plague, lightning bolt, sending, wind wall (no concentration necessary), 3/day each: control weather, darkness, dispel magic, dominate person, freedom of movement, suggestion, 1/day: storm of vengeance

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText: Legendary Resistance (3/day). If Pazuzu fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText: Magic Resistance. Pazuzu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. Pazuzu’s weapon attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Unholy Aura.
abilities.fullText: Unholy Aura. An unholy aura surrounds Pazuzu out to a radius of 40 feet. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is frightened for 1 minute. While frightened, they are paralyzed. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText:
Multiattack. Pazuzu makes two attacks with Carriontooth and two
attacks with its claws.

actions.name: Carriontooth.
actions.fullText:
Carriontooth. Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.
Hit: 38 (8d6 + 10) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.fullText: Claws. Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Corrosive Gas (Recharge 5–6).
actions.fullText:
Corrosive Gas (Recharge 5–6). Pazuzu exhales a cloud of acidic gas
in a 100-foot cone that spreads around corners. Creatures in the area must
make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw, taking 18d8 acid damage on a
failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Dominate Aerial Creature.
actions.fullText:
Dominate Aerial Creature. Pazuzu can target up to six beasts or
monstrosities with a fly speed and an Intelligence lower than 8 and cause
them to make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw,
the target is charmed by Pazuzu for 24 hours. The charmed target obeys
Pazuzu’s verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or
receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the
effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or
if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this ability for the next 24
hours. Pazuzu can have up to six targets charmed at a time. If it charms
another, it can end the charmed condition on one target of its choice.

actions.name: Summon (1/day).
actions.fullText:
Summon (1/day). Pazuzu summons 2d4 succubi, 1d4 nalfeshnees, 1d4
vrocks, or 1 balor. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space
within 60 feet of Pazuzu, but can’t summon other demons. It remains for 1
minute, until it or Pazuzu is slain, or until Pazuzu takes an action to dismiss it.

name: Gibbering Orb
damageResistances: cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
conditionImmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

abilities.name: Hyper-Awareness.
abilities.fullText:
Hyper-Awareness. A lesser gibbering orb can see in all directions at
once and cannot be surprised.

abilities.name: Flyby.
abilities.fullText:
Flyby. The lesser gibbering orb doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack
when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

abilities.name: Gibbering.
abilities.fullText:
Gibbering. The gibbering orb babbles incoherently while it can see any
creature and isn’t incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within
20 feet of the orb that can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 16
Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can’t take reactions until
the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during
its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature
takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a
randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee
attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does
nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. The gibbering orb has advantage on saving throws
against spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Esoteric Theft.
abilities.fullText:
Esoteric Theft. When a creature dies by being swallowed whole (or
when a creature killed by the lesser gibbering orb in some other fashion is
eaten by it), the lesser gibbering orb absorbs the creature’s known spells,
prepared spells, and innate magic abilities. The orb can use one of the
absorbed abilities per turn as a bonus action. Each originates from an eye
that is not producing an eye ray that round. Stolen spells and innate magic
abilities are lost after 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. The gibbering orb makes six bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:
37 (6d8 + 10) piercing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 25)
if the gibbering orb isn’t already grappling a creature, and the target is
restrained until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.fullText:
Swallow. The gibbering orb makes one bite attack against a Large or
smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed,
and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it
has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the gibbering orb,
and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the gibbering orb’s
turns. The gibbering orb can have only one target swallowed at a time.

If the gibbering orb dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained
by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting
prone.

actions.name: Eye Rays.
actions.fullText:
Eye Rays. The orb casts three of the following spells as eye rays at
random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within
150 ft. of it. The spells have a save DC 22 and +14 to hit.  Roll a d20 to determine the effects:

name: Shipbreaker Sea Serpent
senses: blindsight 120 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 22
damageImmunities: cold, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons.

abilities.name: Amphibious.
abilities.fullText: Amphibious. The sea serpent can breathe air and water.

abilities.name: Keen Scent.
abilities.fullText:
Keen Scent. This sea serpent can notice creatures by scent in a 180-foot
radius underwater and can detect blood in the water at a range of up to a
mile.

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If the sea serpent fails a saving throw, it
can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Siege Monster.
abilities.fullText:
Siege Monster. The sea serpent deals double damage to objects and
structures

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText:
Multiattack. The sea serpent can use its frightful presence and make
two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 45
(10d6 + 10) piercing damage and 28 (8d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Ram.
actions.fullText:
Ram. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 65
(10d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.fullText:
Tail. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 37
(6d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence.
actions.fullText:
Frightful Presence. Each creature of the sea serpent’s choice that is
within 120 feet of the sea serpent and aware of it must succeed on a DC 23
Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can
repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on
itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect
ends for it, the creature is immune to the sea serpent’s Frightful Presence
for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Capsize.
actions.fullText:
Capsize. If the sea serpent moves at least 30 feet straight toward
a watercraft (boat, ship, ferry, etc.) and then hits it with a ram attack on
the same turn, there is a chance that it will capsize. All occupants of the
watercraft must make Dexterity saving throw when the craft is rammed (see
below). To determine if the watercraft capsizes, consult the following table:

name: The Ravager (Brawler Form)
senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 26
damageResistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abilities.name: Charge.
abilities.fullText:
Charge. If the Ravager moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature
and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed
on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is
prone, the Ravager can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

abilities.name: Form-Shifting.
abilities.fullText:
Form-Shifting. The Ravager can physically alter its physiology to
take on one of the three listed forms: the crawler, the brawler, or the flier.
Doing so takes one minute, and during this period it cannot take any other
actions, though it is not considered incapacitated.

abilities.name: Improved Critical.
abilities.fullText:
Improved Critical. The Ravager’s bite and claws score a critical hit on
a roll of 19 or 20.

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If the Ravager fails a saving throw, it
can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Disruption.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Disruption. Every time the Ravager comes into contact with
magical effects, there is a chance that it disrupts it. This effect functions as
per the dispel magic spell cast using a 7th level spell slot with a +7 spell
casting ability modifier.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. The Ravager’s melee attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Rampage.
abilities.fullText:
Rampage. When the Ravager reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a
melee attack on its turn, the Ravager can take a bonus action to move up
to half its speed and make a bite attack.

abilities.name: Regeneration.
abilities.fullText:
Regeneration. The Ravager regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn.
If the Ravager takes damage from an artifact or from a legendary action,
this trait doesn’t function at the start of the Ravager’s next turn. The
Ravager only dies if it starts its turn at 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

abilities.name: Vampiric Healing.
abilities.fullText:
Vampiric Healing. Whenever the Ravager hits with a melee attack, it
regains hit points equal to half the damage it inflicts on its opponent, up to
its hit point maximum.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. The Ravager makes one bite and four claw attacks. It can also make a smash attack if it is grappling a creature.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 34
(7d6 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws.
actions.fullText:
Claws. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit:
45 (10d6 + 10) slashing damage and the target is grappled
(Escape DC 23). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained.

actions.name: Smash.
actions.fullText:
Smash. If a target is grappled at the beginning of its turn, the Ravager
may smash it into the ground for 37 (6d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

abilities.name: Tunneler.
abilities.fullText:
Tunneler. The Ravager can burrow through solid rock at half of its
burrowing speed, leaving a 10 foot-wide, 16-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

name: Orcus, Demon Prince of the UndeadWand of Orcus
damageImmunities: lightning, necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
damageResistances: acid, cold, fire

abilities.name: Special equipment.
abilities.fullText: Special equipment. Orcus wields its iconic rod, the Wand of Orcus.

abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Innate Spellcasting. Orcus’s spellcasting ability is Charisma
(spell save DC 28, +20 to hit with spell attacks). Orcus can
innately cast the following spells, requiring no material
components: At will: animate dead, chill touch (17th level), detect magic, 7/day: create undead, 5/day: eyebite, 3/day each: circle of death, finger of death

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText:
Legendary Resistance (3/day). If Orcus fails a saving throw, it
can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Lord of the Grave.
abilities.fullText:
Lord of the Grave. Orcus always casts animate dead or create undead at maximum level and without any restrictions. Creatures created by these spells remain under its control
indefinitely.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells
and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. Orcus’s attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText: Multiattack. Orcus makes two Wand of Orcus attacks.

actions.name: Wand of Orcus.
actions.fullText:
Wand of Orcus. Melee Weapon Attack: +20 to hit, reach 5 ft., one
target. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and the target must make
a DC 17 Charisma saving throw, dropping to 0 hit points on failure, or, on
a success, the target takes 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Tail.
actions.fullText: Tail. Melee Weapon Attack: +20 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) piercing damage plus 22 (4d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Aura of Death.
actions.fullText:
Aura of Death. Each non-undead creature that starts its turn within 20
feet of Orcus takes 17 (5d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Aura of Enfeeblement (Recharge 5–6).
actions.fullText:
Aura of Enfeeblement (Recharge 5–6). Black beams of negative
energy surround Orcus in a 20-foot radius centered on it. Each creature in
this area must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the
target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for 1
minute. A weakened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each
of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target’s saving
throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Orcus’s Aura of Enfeeblement for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Teleport.
actions.fullText:
Teleport. Orcus magically teleports, along with any equipment it is
wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

name: Tsathogga, the Frog God
languages: Aquan, Abyssal, Common, Giant, Infernal, Terran, telepathy 120 ft.
damageImmunities: acid, lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
damageResistances: cold, fire

abilities.name: Acidic Hide.
abilities.fullText:
Acidic Hide. A creature that touches Tsathogga or hits it with a melee
attack while within 10 feet of it takes 35 (10d6) acid damage. Any
nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits Tsathogga instantly
dissolves before dealing damage.

abilities.name: Amphibious.
abilities.fullText: Amphibious. Tsathogga can breathe both water and air.

abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting.
abilities.fullText:
Innate Spellcasting. Tsathogga’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma
(spell save DC 24, +16 to hit with spell attacks). At will: acid arrow (5th level), bane, blindness/deafness, blight,
command, detect magic, fog cloud, grease, inflict wounds (5th level), 7/day each: antilife shell, circle of death, cloudkill, contagion,
counterspell, dispel magic, dominate beast, dominate person, earthquake, 3/day each: geas, harm, 1/day each: control weather, power word kill, storm of vengeance, wish

abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day).
abilities.fullText: Legendary Resistance (3/day). If Tsathogga fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

abilities.name: Magic Resistance.
abilities.fullText:
Magic Resistance. Tsathogga has advantage on saving throws against
spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Magic Weapons.
abilities.fullText: Magic Weapons. Tsathogga’s weapon attacks are magical.

abilities.name: Unholy Aura.
abilities.fullText:
Unholy Aura. An unholy aura surrounds Tsathogga out to a radius of 40
feet. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must make a DC
20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is frightened
for 1 minute. While frightened, they are paralyzed. A frightened target can
repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect
on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack.
actions.fullText:
Multiattack. Tsathogga uses its Blasphemous Croak ability, then uses
its tongue attack. If there is a creature within range, it can then use its bite
attack and two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite.
actions.fullText:
Bite. Up to three targets of Huge size or smaller within 10 feet of
Tsathogga must make a DC 27 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful
saving throw, it takes 44 (10d6 + 9) piercing damage, plus 35 (10d6)
acid damage, and is grappled. On a failed saving throw, the target is
swallowed. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has
total cover against attacks and other effects outside of Tsathogga, and it
takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of Tsathogga’s turns. If
Tsathogga takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside
it, Tsathogga must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the
end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in
a space with 10 feet of Tsathogga. If Tsathogga dies, a swallowed creature
is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using all of its
movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Claw.
actions.fullText:
Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 40
(9d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 35 (10d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Tongue.
actions.fullText:
Tongue. Tsathogga chooses one creature that it can see within 40 feet
of it. That target must make a DC 28 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed
saving throw, the target takes 37 (8d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 35
(10d6) acid damage and is grappled. Tsathogga can use a bonus action to
pull a creature grappled by it up to 40 feet towards it.

actions.name: Blasphemous Croak.
actions.fullText:
Blasphemous Croak. Tsathogga utters a blasphemous croak audible to
all creatures within 300 feet of it. Those that can hear it must make a DC
24 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 28
(8d6) necrotic damage and 28 (8d6) thunder damage and is stunned for 1
minute. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half damage and is
not stunned. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of
each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Summon (1/day).
actions.fullText:
Summon (1/day). Tsathogga summons 2d6 hezrous, 2d4 greruors, 1
nalfeshnee, or 1 balor. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied
space within 60 feet of Tsathogga, and can’t summon other demons. It
remains for 1 minute, until it or Tsathogga is slain, or until Tsathogga
takes an action to dismiss it.
